intro: Gymnadenia vernalis, commonly known as the early gentian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. This perennial herb typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its striking blue or purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and is often found in association with other early-flowering species.
